title: Saudi attacks to have 'short-term' impact, affect oil prices - Iran oil minister
text:
FILE PHOTO: Iran's Oil Minister Bijan Zanganeh listens to journalists at the beginning of an OPEC meeting in Vienna, Austria, July 1, 2019. REUTERS/Leonhard Foeger

DUBAI (Reuters) - Iran’s oil minister said on Wednesday attacks on Saudi oil installations at the weekend will have a “short-term” impact, but they will affect crude prices, the semi-official news agency ISNA reported.

“The effects of this event will be short-term, but it will affect the price of oil in all countries,” Bijan Zanganeh said, according to ISNA.
description: Iran's oil minister said on Wednesday attacks on Saudi oil installations at the weekend will have a "short-term" impact, but they will affect crude prices, the semi-official news agency ISNA reported.
